result.execSummary:
The defendant Santos J Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.
Must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Probation may be served in Lake County, Illinois.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  Obtain HSED or GED.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations, including any outstanding ZCI (Zimmerman Consulting Inc) testing and monitoring fees.  Cooperate with any assessments determined appropriate and follow through with counseling, treatment and programs recommendations.  No contact with gangs or gang members.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Absolute sobriety is required.

PSI - Reviewed / no changes

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting with attorney, going to school, working with step-father and medical appointments.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED  06-09-2014- GPS MAY BE REMOVED
Sentencing hearing on September 4, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Santos J Perez in court with attorney Patrick K Cafferty.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
